articles.description: British billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe agrees a deal to buy a 25% stake in Manchester United from the Glazer family.
articles.title: Ratcliffe agrees deal to buy 25% Man Utd stake

articles.description: Wolves condemn wasteful Chelsea to another defeat in the Premier League.
articles.title: Wolves condemn wasteful Chelsea to another defeat

articles.description: What happens in the January transfer window? What about Old Trafford improvements? What about Erik ten Hag's future? Assessing the key issues for Sir Jim Ratcliffe at Man Utd.
articles.title: What will be on Ratcliffe's agenda at Man Utd?

articles.description: Anthony Joshua emerges as the biggest winner from a revolutionary card in Saudi Arabia as a possible Deontay Wilder fight slips away again.
articles.title: Joshua v Wilder fades as 'greatest card' goes awry

articles.description: The Miami Dolphins get a dramatic win over the Dallas Cowboys to make the play-offs as the Detroit Lions win their division for the first time in almost 30 years.
articles.title: Dolphins down Dallas to book play-off spot

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on Future Islands frontman and Everton fan Samuel T Herring to make predictions for the festive Premier League fixtures.
articles.title: Sutton's Premier League festive predictions v Future Islands frontman Samuel T Herring

articles.description: Bravemansgame and Allaho are among contenders for the King George VI Chase at Kempton on Boxing Day.
articles.title: Bravemansgame and Allaho among King George runners

articles.description: Which players impressed our football pundit Garth Crooks enough to make his latest Team of the Week?
articles.title: Who played the pass of the season? Garth Crooks' Team of the Week

articles.description: The Detroit Pistons are beaten 126-115 by the Brooklyn Nets as they equal an NBA record of 26 defeats in a row during a season.
articles.title: NBA: Detroit Pistons equal 26-match NBA losing record with Brooklyn Nets defeat

articles.description: India registered their first women's Test win over Australia with an eight-wicket victory in a one-off match in Mumbai.
articles.title: India beat Australia in women's Test for first time
